solution_line_template: Two pairs of sunglasses costs {sunglasses_pairs} x ${sunglasses_price} = $<<{sunglasses_pairs}*{sunglasses_price}={sunglasses_total}>>{sunglasses_total}.
Thus, two decks of basketball cards costs ${mary_total} - ${rose_shoes_price} = $<<{mary_total}-{rose_shoes_price}={two_decks_price}>>{two_decks_price}.
Therefore, one deck of basketball cards costs ${two_decks_price}/{decks_count} = $<<{two_decks_price}/{decks_count}={one_deck_price}>>{one_deck_price}.
